str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I am awake (in the night), watch, (b) I am watchful, on the alert, vigilant. From egeiro; to keep awake, i.e. Watch.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural

str2: When, at what time. From the base of pou and te; interrogative adverb, at what time.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular

str2: Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Late, in the evening. From the same as opiso; late in the day; by extension, after the close of the day.
Midnight, the middle of the period between sunset and sunrise. Neuter of compound of mesos and nux; midnight.
From alektor and phone; cock-crow, i.e. The third night-watch.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Early in the morning, at dawn. Adverb from pro; at dawn; by implication, the day-break watch.
